intro: Hirtella rasa, commonly known as the small-leaved hirtella, is a species of flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pink and are clustered in small inflorescences. Hirtella rasa is often found in moist, shaded environments within the dense understory of tropical forests.
